title: Why if i have to reconnect does riot put me in a lower que?
body: I had to restart my computer and router and Riot decided i abandoned the match. this is false and oppressive. i literally had to re connect and riot punished me. riot forces one to play and punishes them if they have any problems. this is unfair and riot is to blame. any hiccup in the game or your life and they punish you.

replies.body:
It's definitely frustrating getting kicked for random issues like pc restarts or router issues, but a leave for any reason is still kinda screwing over the other players on your team. You shouldn't get punished for just one instance either, and if you're still having any of these issues we should get to troubleshooting asap before it happens over and over.

Was this any kind of specific problem that you were aware of or did your pc just randomly restart on its own? Might be able to figure this out with more info.

It’s not false - you admit that you abandoned the match.

You are not issued a Low Priority Queue for one game of leaving/AFK/disconnecting behavior. In fact, I’ve left multiple games over the past few months for legitimate reasons and I have not been given a LPQ ever. If you got a LPQ, you either have these issues frequently, or you have intentionally left games in the past.

NICE method of arguing asshole. this probably happens to alot of people. and riot wrongfully punishes them. there is no way around that. league of legends is just a big corporate company and you work for them obv

i admit i had to take care of the problem and fix it so my team could continue playing. surely a punishable offense.

RIOT THE OPPRESSOR
